header.title: The Pauline Art: Book III of the Lemegeton

central_thesis: The Pauline Art provides a comprehensive system for invoking specific angelic intelligences governing the hours of the day and night, as well as the degrees of the Zodiac, to gain knowledge, assistance, and influence various terrestrial and personal affairs. This is achieved through precise astrological calculations, the creation and consecration of seals, and formal conjurations tailored to specific angelic hierarchies and planetary influences.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part 1: Angels of the Hours of the Day & Night
structure_content.summary: This part details the 24 Angels governing each hour of the day and night, along with their numerous Dukes and servants. It explains how the nature and offices of these angels are influenced by the ruling planet of the specific hour and day. The primary focus is on the operative method for creating seals: first calculating an astrological chart for the desired time, then engraving the character of the Lord of the Ascendant, followed by other planetary glyphs, and finally the sign of the 12th house. Specific examples are provided, set for Wednesday, March 10th, 1641, for the first hour of the day. A general conjuration formula is given to address the Chief Angel and subsequently their subordinates.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part 2: Angels of the Signs of the Zodiac
structure_content.summary: This section describes the 'Angels of men' attributed to each of the 12 signs of the Zodiac and their individual degrees. It posits that by knowing one's birth chart, one can ascertain their governing angel to gain wisdom and knowledge. The angels are categorized by elemental regions (Fire, Earth, Air, Water), each ruled by a specific Archangel (Michael, Uriel, Raphiel, Gabriel) and associated with specific zodiac signs and optimal seasons for observation. The text outlines the creation of seals for these zodiacal angels, which involves melting specific planetary metals when the Sun enters the relevant zodiacal sign and then engraving planetary and zodiacal characters.

key_concepts.definition: Celestial intelligences assigned to govern each of the 24 hours of the day and night, possessing specific offices and powers attributed to the planetary ruler of that hour and day. They operate with numerous Dukes and servants.

key_concepts.term: Angels of the Signs/Degrees (Angels of Men)
key_concepts.definition: Angelic entities associated with the 12 zodiacal signs and their individual degrees. These angels can be identified through one's natal chart and invoked to impart wisdom, knowledge, and assistance in matters relating to one's life path.

Talismanic engravings, typically on metal, whose designs are meticulously calculated based on a precise astrological chart for the hour and day of operation. They incorporate planetary characters, the glyph of the Lord of the Ascendant, and the sign of the 12th house. These seals serve as focal points or conduits for angelic invocation.

A formal, structured invocation, typically delivered in two parts: first to the Chief governing Angel of the hour/hierarchy using divine names (e.g., Jehovah, Tetragrammaton, Agla), followed by a specific address to the desired Duke or servant, requesting their presence and assistance for a particular will or task.

A ritual surface or object, likely inscribed with planetary or zodiacal characters, upon which a prepared angelic seal is placed during an operation. The seal must be positioned on the part of the table corresponding to the character of the Lord of the Ascendant.

The planetary ruler of the zodiacal sign ascending on the eastern horizon at the exact moment of a magical operation. This planet is a critical determinant for the design of the angelic seal and influences the nature of the invoked power, often taking precedence over the traditional planetary ruler of the hour.

A classification system for angels based on their attribution to the four elemental regions (Fiery, Earthly, Airy, Watery). Each hierarchy is governed by a specific Archangel (Michael, Uriel, Raphiel, Gabriel) and is associated with particular zodiac signs and optimal seasonal periods for successful operation.

practical_system.description: The Pauline Art outlines a system for direct angelic invocation, meticulously tied to astrological timings and conditions. The core mechanism involves identifying the specific angel and its hierarchy based on either the hour of the day/night or a zodiacal degree. The operative side centers on constructing a unique seal for each invocation, a process that requires a full astrological chart calculation for the precise moment of working. The Lord of the Ascendant is paramount, dictating key elements of the seal and the placement on the ritual 'Table of Practice.' The goal is to establish familiar friendship with angels for guidance, knowledge, and assistance in worldly affairs.
tools: Astrological ephemeris or software for precise chart calculation

Specific metals for seal fabrication (e.g., gold for Sun, silver for Moon, copper for Venus, iron for Mars, tin for Jupiter, lead for Saturn, quicksilver/mercury for Mercury) as dictated by planetary attributions and specific seal instructions
Engraving tools for creating the seals
Table of Practice (a ritual surface marked with planetary/zodiacal characters)
Crystal Stone (for scrying and receiving visible appearance of angels)
Parchment or clean paper (for preliminary seal designs)
A silver ring (specified for certain seals, like Saturn's).
rituals: Determine the specific angel (Chief Angel, Duke, or servant) for the desired hour of the day/night or zodiacal degree. This selection is often made based on the nature of the desired operation and the angelic hierarchy associated with specific planetary and elemental attributions.

Calculate a precise astrological chart for the intended time and location of the operation. This includes identifying the Lord of the Ascendant, the sign on the cusp of the 12th house, and the positions of all other planets.

Construct the angelic seal: This involves engraving the character of the Lord of the Ascendant prominently in the center, surrounding it with the characters of other planets in counter-clockwise order (from fastest to slowest), and adding the character/sign of the 12th house cusp. The seals for zodiacal angels also involve melting specific planetary metals when the Sun is in the relevant zodiacal sign and engraving characters.
Prepare a suitable perfume composed of materials attributed to the 7 planets.
Place the completed seal on a designated section of the 'Table of Practice' that corresponds to the character of the Lord of the Ascendant.

Perform a two-part conjuration: First, invoke the Chief governing Angel of the hour (e.g., Samael for the 1st hour) using powerful divine names (e.g., Jehovah, Tetragrammaton, Adonay). Second, invoke the specific Duke or servant by name, requesting their visible appearance in a crystal stone and their assistance with the practitioner's will.
Welcome the invoked spirit, communicate desires, and then formally dismiss them according to a prescribed order.

relevant_quotes.text: & this is divided into two parts, the first the Angels of the Hours of the Day & Night, the second the Angels of the signs of the Zodiack, as hereafter followeth.

To create the seal for the angels of a particular hour, the magician first casts the astrological chart for that hour in the day the work is to be done. The planetary glyph to be drawn in the center of the seal is the planet ruling the sign on the Ascen-dant of the chart.

O thou Mighty & potent Angel Samael, who rulest the first hour of the day, I the ser-vant of the most high God, do Conjure & instruct thee in the name of the most high omnip-otent & immortal God of Hosts Jehovah |*| Tetragrammaton & by the name & in the name of that God that you owe obediency to, & by the head of your Hierarchy & by the seal of mark you are known in power by, & by the 7 Angels that stands before the Throne of God, & by the 7 Planets & their seals & characters & by the Angel that ruleth the sign of the 12th. house which now ascends in thy first hour, that you would be so graciously pleased to gird up yourself together & by divine permission to move & come from all parts of the world wheresoever you be & show thyself visibly & plainly in this crystal stone to the light of mine eyes, speaking with a voice intelligible & to my understanding, & that you would be favorably pleased that I may have thy familiar friendship & constant society both now and at all times when I shall call thee forth to visible appearance, to inform & direct me in all things that shall seem good & lawful unto the Creator & thee, O thou great & powerful Angel Samael I invocate Adjure Command & most powerfully call you forth from your orders & places of residence to visible appearance in & through these great & mighty incomprehensible Signall & divine name of the great God who wast, is & ever shall be, Adonay Zebaoth, Adonay Amioram, Hagios Aglaon Tetragrammaton & by & in the name Primeumaton which commandeth the whole host of heaven, whose power & virtue is most Effectual for the calling you forth & command you to transmit your rays perfectly to my sight & voice to my ears, in & through this Celestial Stone, that I may plainly see you & perfectly hear you speak unto me, therefore move O thou mighty & blessed Angel Samael, & by his present name of the great God Jehovah, & by the Imperial Dignity thereof, descend & show your self visibly & perfectly in a pleasant & comely form before me in this Crystal Stone to the sight of mine eyes, speaking with a voice intelligible to appre-hension, declaring & accomplishing all my desires that I shall ask or require of you, both herein & whatsoever truth or thing also that is just & lawful before the presence of Almighty God the Giver of all good gifts, unto whom I beg that he would be graciously pleased to bestow upon me, O thou servant of mercy Samael, be thou therefore friendly unto me & do for me, as the servant of the most high God, so far as God shall give you power to perform, whereunto I move you both in power & presence to appear, that I may sing with thee his holy Angel O-Napa-ta-man halle-le-la-jah, Amen.

These be the 12 Angels that are attributed to the 12 signs (of the Zodiac), because of those that hath not got the very degree of their nativity, so that they may make use of these Angels, if be so that they know the sign that ascends.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Pauline Art stands as a unique and sophisticated text within the Solomonic grimoire tradition, particularly noted for its heavy reliance on precise astrological calculations. Unlike many other grimoires that might provide pre-established seals and fixed times, the Pauline Art requires the practitioner to dynamically generate operative elements (seals, timing) based on the exact astrological conditions of their desired working. Its explicit emphasis on the 'Lord of the Ascendant' as the primary planetary influence for seals, rather than solely relying on traditional planetary hours, represents a notable technical distinction from other magical systems. This deep integration of classical astrology (specifically, a house system like Meridian or Porphyry) with angelic evocation marks it as a work for the dedicated and technically proficient magician. Its insights into angelic hierarchies, their specific offices, and the intricate methods for their engagement provide a rich field for both historical and practical occult study.
critical_analysis.target_audience: This work is clearly intended for advanced practitioners of ceremonial magic and astrology. The text itself notes that effective practice requires 'a detailed knowledge of both mathematics and astronomy,' suggesting an audience with a strong foundation in astrological chart calculation (which, in the 17th century, was a laborious and specialized skill). It presupposes an understanding of planetary rulerships, zodiacal signs, house systems, and the ability to interpret and calculate complex astrological conditions. Novices would find the preparatory astrological work insurmountable without significant prior study or modern software aids. Thus, it targets those committed to a rigorous, academically informed approach to practical esotericism.
